memberdef.definition: __host__ __device__ constexpr amrex::ArrayND< T, N, last_dim_component >::operator bool
memberdef.name: operator bool

briefdescription.para: Check if the ArrayND pointer is valid.

simplesect.para: true if pointer is valid, false otherwise.

memberdef.definition: __host__ __device__ constexpr bool amrex::ArrayND< T, N, last_dim_component >::ok
memberdef.name: ok

briefdescription.para: Check if the ArrayND pointer is valid and bounds are valid.

simplesect.para: true if pointer and bounds are valid, false otherwise.

param.type: std::enable_if_t<!std::is_void_v< U > &&!IsArray4_v &&detail::ArrayNDIndexCheck_impl_v< N, last_dim_component, idx... >, int >

briefdescription.para: Multi-index operator() for accessing elements.

detaileddescription.para: This operator is only enabled when the number of indices provided matches the dimension N or N-1 if last_dim_component is true, where in the latter case the last dimension is assumed to be 0. The passed indices must be of integral types that can be converted to int without narrowing. The last index can also be an enum type.

simplesect.para: This overload is disabled for Array4, which has its own overload of operator() that takes three integer indices for spatial dimensions and an optional integer component index.
Reference to the element.

briefdescription.para: Access element by IntVectND.

detaileddescription.para:
This function handles access via:
Full dimension vector (M == N).
Spatial dimension vector (M == N-1) && !IsArray4_v (only enabled if last_dim_component is true).

parameterdescription.para: The dimension of the index vector.

simplesect.para: Reference to the element.

memberdef.argsstring: (IntVectND< M > const &iv, int n) const noexcept
memberdef.name: operator()

briefdescription.para: Access element by spatial IntVectND and component index.

detaileddescription.para: This overload is enabled only when last_dim_component is true and M represents the spatial dimensions (either N-1 or AMREX_SPACEDIM).

parameterdescription.para: The dimension of the spatial index vector (typically N-1 or AMREX_SPACEDIM).

simplesect.para: Reference to the element.

param.type: std::enable_if_t<!std::is_void_v< U > &&!IsArray4_v &&detail::ArrayNDIndexCheck_impl_v< N, last_dim_component, idx... >, int >

briefdescription.para: Multi-index ptr() for accessing pointer to element.

simplesect.para: Pointer to the element.

briefdescription.para: Access pointer by IntVectND.

detaileddescription.para:
This function handles access via:
Full dimension vector (M == N).
Spatial dimension vector (M == N-1) && !IsArray4_v (only enabled if last_dim_component is true).

parameterdescription.para: The dimension of the index vector.

simplesect.para: Pointer to the element.

memberdef.argsstring: (IntVectND< M > const &iv, int n) const noexcept
memberdef.name: ptr

briefdescription.para: Access pointer by spatial IntVectND and component index.

detaileddescription.para: This overload is enabled only when last_dim_component is true and M represents the spatial dimensions (either N-1 or AMREX_SPACEDIM).

parameterdescription.para: The dimension of the spatial index vector (typically N-1 or AMREX_SPACEDIM).

simplesect.para: Pointer to the element.

memberdef.definition: __host__ __device__ constexpr std::size_t amrex::ArrayND< T, N, last_dim_component >::size
memberdef.name: size

briefdescription.para: Total number of elements in the ArrayND's index region.

detaileddescription.para: Returns the product of extents in each dimension. If the object is not valid (see ok()), this returns 0.

simplesect.para: Number of elements in the ArrayND, or 0 if invalid.

memberdef.definition: __host__ __device__ constexpr Long amrex::ArrayND< T, N, last_dim_component >::get_stride
memberdef.name: get_stride

briefdescription.para: Return the stride (in elements) for dimension d.

detaileddescription.para: This returns the multiplier used to advance the linear address when incrementing index d by one. For d==0, the stride is 1.

parameterdescription.para: Dimension index in the range [0, N).

simplesect.para: Stride for dimension d, in number of elements.

memberdef.definition: __host__ __device__ constexpr bool amrex::ArrayND< T, N, last_dim_component >::contains
memberdef.name: contains

briefdescription.para: Test whether an index tuple lies inside the ArrayND bounds.

detaileddescription.para: This overload accepts a pack of integer indices and it is disabled for Array4, which has its own overload of contains that takes three integer indices for spatial dimensions.

simplesect.para: true if all indices are within bounds.

memberdef.definition: __host__ __device__ constexpr bool amrex::ArrayND< T, N, last_dim_component >::contains
memberdef.name: contains

briefdescription.para: Test whether an IntVectND lies inside the ArrayND bounds.

detaileddescription.para: Checks whether each component of iv is within the half-open bounds [begin, end) for the corresponding dimensions.

This overload supports two cases:
M==N : the full index space is checked; if the last dimension is a component dimension, it is checked as well. This can be used Array4.
(M+1==N) with last_dim_component=true : only the spatial dimensions are checked (component handled separately).

simplesect.para: true if iv is inside the bounds, otherwise false.

memberdef.definition: __host__ __device__ constexpr bool amrex::ArrayND< T, N, last_dim_component >::contains
memberdef.argsstring: (IntVectND< M > const &iv, int n) const noexcept
memberdef.name: contains

briefdescription.para: Test whether a spatial index and component lie inside the bounds.

detaileddescription.para: Checks that the spatial index iv is within [begin, end) for the spatial dimensions and that the component index n satisfies 0 <= n < end[N-1].
This overload is enabled only when the last dimension is a component dimension.

parameterdescription.para: Spatial dimension of the input IntVectND.

simplesect.para: true if both the spatial index and component are inside, otherwise false.

memberdef.definition: __host__ __device__ CellData< T > amrex::ArrayND< T, N, last_dim_component >::cellData
memberdef.argsstring: (int i, int j, int k) const noexcept
memberdef.name: cellData

briefdescription.para: Create a single-cell component accessor.

detaileddescription.para: Returns a CellData<T> view for the cell $(i,j,k)$ in an Array4. The returned object provides access to all components without recomputing full (i,j,k,n) indexing.

simplesect.para: A CellData<T> accessor for cell $(i,j,k)$.
This overload is enabled only for Array4.

simplesect.para: Linear offset in number of elements from base pointer p.

memberdef.argsstring: (IntVectND< M > const &iv, int n) const noexcept

briefdescription.para: Compute the linear offset (in elements) for an IntVectND and component index.

memberdef.argsstring: (int i, int j, int k) const noexcept
memberdef.name: operator()

briefdescription.para: Access Array4 element using three integer spatial indices.

detaileddescription.para: The component index is implicitly assumed to be zero. When AMREX_SPACEDIM is less than 3, the bounds for extra spatial dimensions are typically [0,1). In particular, when launching a kernel with amrex::ParallelFor(Box, f), where f is a lambda function with the signature of void(int i,int j,int k), AMReX supplies zero for the extra dimensions. Thus this operator is safe under the usual AMReX execution model.

simplesect.para: This overload is enabled only for Array4.

memberdef.argsstring: (int i, int j, int k, int n) const noexcept
memberdef.name: operator()

briefdescription.para: Access Array4 element using three integer spatial indices and component index.

detaileddescription.para: When AMREX_SPACEDIM is less than 3, the bounds for extra spatial dimensions are typically [0,1). For example, when AMREX_SPADIM is 2, k should typically be zero.

simplesect.para: This overload is enabled only for Array4.

briefdescription.para: Access Array4 element by spatial indices in IntVectND.

detaileddescription.para: The component index is implicitly assumed to be zero. The dimension of iv is either 3 or AMREX_SPACEDIM. If it's less than 3, zero is used in the extra dimensions.

memberdef.argsstring: (IntVectND< M > const &iv, int n) const noexcept
memberdef.name: operator()

briefdescription.para: Access Array4 element by spatial indices in IntVectND and component index.

detaileddescription.para: The dimension of iv is either 3 or AMREX_SPACEDIM. If it's less than 3, zero is used in the extra dimensions.

briefdescription.para: Access Array4 element by spatial indices in Dim3.

detaileddescription.para: The component index is implicitly assumed to be zero.

briefdescription.para: Access Array4 element by spatial indices in Dim3 and component index.

memberdef.definition: __host__ __device__ constexpr void amrex::ArrayND< T, N, last_dim_component >::set_stride
memberdef.name: set_stride

briefdescription.para: A multidimensional array accessor.

detaileddescription.para:
T
The type of data (e.g., Real, int). May be const-qualified.
N
The dimension of the array (rank).
last_dim_component
If true, the last dimension represents components rather than a spatial index. In this case, the component index always starts at zero.
ArrayND is a lightweight, non-owning wrapper around a pointer that provides multidimensional indexing into a contiguous memory block. It is trivially copyable and designed to be passed by value into GPU kernels. Note, ArrayND follows fortran-style column-major ordering.
It stores the pointer, stride information, and the bounds (begin and end) of the array.

simplesect.para: Array4 is an alias of ArrayND with N=4 and last_dim_component=true. It represents three spatial dimensions plus one component dimension. When AMREX_SPACEDIM is less than 3, the extra spatial dimensions typically have bounds [0,1), and the correspding indices are zero.
